job_title: Clinical Program Manager in Phoenix, AZ
cons: The few and minuscule downsides some times come with being understaffed but it’s a very supportive environment.

review_title: Rewarding job but not good work life balance.
job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
Overtime was available.
Locations all over the valley.
Great clients to work with. 
Good job if you’re new to the field.
cons:
Very understaffed - I was working 50-60 hours weeks and looked down on if I didn’t cover shifts. FSL pledges that staff’s health is so important and they need to be careful not to burnout.. ironic isn’t it? If you didn’t take open shifts they’d all together giving you the opportunity & it was basically looked down upon.
Received only one raise during the two years that I was there and it was only 30 cents. Disappointing when I put in so much hard work and effort with the clients and it was so unnoticed. 
Management, located downtown, never came to visit the homes so they had no idea how they were being run. My supervisor at the group wasn’t too bad; however, she never came dressed professionally. She was also constantly assigning me tasks to do and take credit for them. She was also not very organized and the group home wasn’t organized either.

pros: Great staff good people nice benefits
cons: Horrible CEO and his friendly assistant

pros: FSL has been in the business of helping the most vulnerable citizens of our community for over 40 years.  The actual "business" could not be accomplished without the dedication of its employees, many of whom have been with FSL 10, 15, 20+ years -- some from the beginning!  It's most telling about an agency that retains that kind of loyalty and effort, especially as a nonprofit where the bottom line is PEOPLE AND SERVICES, not monies or commodities.
cons: An employee of about a year posted a review that praised management but disparaged long-term "non-executives" as "stuck in their old ways, not seeing great changes or pushing to do more."  These comments are arrogant and condescending - indicative of one who thinks way too highly of herself.  This person needs to mature and become a TEAM player, ingratiating herself with those same "non-executives" who make up the base -- the foundation -- of this agency.  It's  not smart to try to flatter administration while ignoring the wisdom of those who, over the years, have seen this type of personality start but never finish.  Denigration is not endearing and will NEVER inspire.

job_title: Medical Logistics Technician in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Great Team, Great Company, Fair wages
cons: I have been here a year and no cons so far.

pros: Very friendly people, good work env.
cons: None that i encountered in my time

review_title: TIME SHOWS THE TRUE HEART OF THE STAFF
pros: Being a long time employee, I have seen where the heart of those that are still with this company 10 years plus later.  You can see that those people are truly vested into what this company has set out to do.  It is those people that have made this company what it is in the public eye.  It is an honor to serve with such distinguished, honorable, and compassionate people as those that have served our diverse people groups for such a long time.  One would say that they have the heart, soul, mind, and well being of the people we serve as fore most in their thoughts and actions.  Time proves they love the people groups we serve, because they are still standing in the trenches for our people groups.
cons: The regrettable words of an employee that has not been with the company long enough to see that those that have been here the longest, and still remain are the heart and soul of this company

review_title: You Get Out What  You Put In!
job_title: Wellness Program Coordinator in Phoenix, AZ
pros: The Executive Team is so forward thinking. They value and encourage communication. They know your name and make you feel so valued and heard. Truly enjoy this positive and rich environment that I know I will be growing in!
cons: The other employees (non executives) who have been here for a very long time seem to be stuck in their old ways. Wish they saw the great changes and pushed for doing more. But hey you can't change everyone.

pros:
Local company making decisions that positively impact the Arizona community
Emphasis is placed on client and community needs
40+ year history in this community
Seen as an expert in the fields of affordable housing and home- and community-based services
Leadership empowers staff to share innovative ideas
Very exciting time as we transition out of the "Best Kept Secret in Town" and start shining a light on all the good work that FSL does!
cons:
I wish we had more funding to do more for those who have less
I wish this organization were better known in the community

pros: The FSL culture reminds me of what Corporate America culture USED to be.  FSL people are friendly and accepting; I enjoy coming to work in the morning once again.

centrally located in Phoenix - close to all freeways.  they have a very nice building and give you laptops for paperless charting. the benefits used to be good with many employees staying there for years but that has changed tremendously now.
cons: nasty vindictive nursing management. they delight in making employee's life hell. all  the nurses that have been there for years were fired or quit with the hiring of a certain ADON a few years ago. salaries are now below average for a major city.

pros: great customer service, friendly, caring co-workers. Their services for the elderly are wonderful. They have caring employees.
cons: Web page could use some updating

pros: Working together with others to serve those in need in our community.
cons: Wages are not very competitive due to non-profit status.
